questions.question: We had a press pass but ………………………… refused admittance anyhow.
As he ………………………. older, his mind regressed further into the past.
questions.description: Use the simple past to talk about two past events that took place simultaneously.

questions.question: I ………………………… any regrets over anything I have ever done.
questions.description: Either don't have or have never had is possible here.

questions.question: She was made …………………………. the whole story.
questions.description: Made is followed by a to-infinitive in passive structures.

questions.question: Reading books ……………………….. a good hobby.
questions.description: Here the subject is the ing form reading ing forms are treated as singular.

questions.question: Suma as well as her sisters ……………………….. at the party.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: John along with his friends ……………………….. in that house.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with 'along with', the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: Do you know where ………………………?
questions.description: In indirect questions, the verb goes after the subject.

questions.question: Scarcely …………………………. one project before she started another.
questions.description: Either had she finished or did she finish is correct here.

questions.question: Each guest ………………………. welcomed with open arms.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Every student …………………….. handed in their work.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after every.
